1  /**
  2  * @fileOverview implementation of a log layer on top of console.*
  3 */
  4 
  5 var Stacktrace	= Stacktrace	|| require('./stacktrace.js');
  6 
  7 /**
  8  * @namespace logger compatible with console.* calls
  9  */
 10 var ConsoleLogger	= {};
 11 
 12 /**
 13  * the previous instance of console object
 14 */
 15 ConsoleLogger._origConsole	= {
 16 	console	: console,
 17 	log	: console.log,
 18 	warn	: console.warn,
 19 	error	: console.error
 20 };
 21 
 22 
 23 // export the class in node.js - if running in node.js
 24 if( typeof(window) === 'undefined' )	module.exports	= ConsoleLogger;
 25 
 26 /**
 27  * Des ription of the various level of severity
 28  * @type {Object}
 29  */
 30 ConsoleLogger.Severity	= {
 31 	'all'		: 0,
 32 	'log'		: 1,
 33 	'warn'		: 2,
 34 	'error'		: 3,
 35 	'nothing'	: 99
 36 };
 37 
 38 /**
 39  * default level of severity when no filter matches
 40  * 
 41  * @type {Number}
 42  */
 43 ConsoleLogger.Severity.dfl	= ConsoleLogger.Severity.all;
 44 
 45 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 46 //		handle formatters							//
 47 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 48 
 49 /**
 50  * formater which doesnt change anything
 51  * 
 52  * @param  {Array} args	the ```arguments``` of the logger funciton
 53  * @param  {Stacktrace.Frame}	stackFrame the stackframe of the origin 
 54  * @param  {string} severity	severity of the message
 55  * @return {Array}		the formated args
 56  */
 57 ConsoleLogger.formatterIdentity	= function(args, stackFrame, severity){
 58 	return args;
 59 }
 60 
 61 /**
 62  * formater which add a timestamp as prefix to the message - with color if in node
 63  * 
 64  * @param  {Array} args	the ```arguments``` of the logger funciton
 65  * @param  {Stacktrace.Frame}	stackFrame the stackframe of the origin 
 66  * @param  {string} severity	severity of the message
 67  * @return {Array}		the formated args
 68  */
 69 ConsoleLogger.formatterTimeStamp	= function(args, stackFrame, severity){
 70 	// build prefix with time
 71 	var present	= new Date();
 72 	var prefixColor	= ConsoleLogger._formatterSeverityColor(severity);
 73 	var prefix	= prefixColor + pad(present.getHours(),2)
 74 				+ ':'
 75 				+ pad(present.getMinutes(),2)
 76 				+ ':'
 77 				+ pad(present.getSeconds(),2)
 78 				+ ConsoleLogger._formatterColor.reset;
 79 	// convert arguments into actual Array
 80 	args	= Array.prototype.slice.call(args, 0);
 81 	// prepend the prefix
 82 	args.unshift(prefix);
 83 	// return the result
 84 	return args;
 85 
 86 	function pad(val, len) {
 87 		val = String(val);
 88 		while(val.length < len) val = "0" + val;
 89 		return val;
 90 	};
 91 };
 92 
 93 /**
 94  * formater which add the origin as prefix to the message - with color if in node
 95  * 
 96  * @param  {Array} args	the ```arguments``` of the logger funciton
 97  * @param  {Stacktrace.Frame}	stackFrame the stackframe of the origin 
 98  * @param  {string} severity	severity of the message
 99  * @return {Array}		the formated args
100  */
101 ConsoleLogger.formatterOrigin	= function(args, stackFrame, severity)
102 {
103 	// compute prefix
104 	var prefixColor	= ConsoleLogger._formatterSeverityColor(severity);
105 	var prefix	= prefixColor + stackFrame.originId() + ConsoleLogger._formatterColor.reset;
106 	// convert arguments into actual Array
107 	args		= Array.prototype.slice.call(args, 0);
108 	// prepend the prefix
109 	args.unshift(prefix);
110 	// return the result
111 	return args;
112 }
113 
114 /**
115  * flag to know if it is running in node.js or browser
116  * @type {Boolean}
117  */
118 ConsoleLogger._inNode	= typeof(window) === 'undefined' ? true : false;
119 /**
120  * Color code for ansi tty
121  * @type {String}
122  */
123 ConsoleLogger._formatterColor	= {
124 	black	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[30m',
125 	red	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[31m',
126 	green	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[32m',
127 	yellow	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[33m',
128 	blue	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[34m',
129 	purple	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[35m',
130 	cyan	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[36m',
131 	white	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[37m',
132 	reset	: ConsoleLogger._inNode === false ? '' : '\033[0m'
133 };
134 
135 /**
136  * return ainsi color per intensity
137  * @param  {String} severity the severity of the message
138  * @return {String} ansi color string
139  */
140 ConsoleLogger._formatterSeverityColor	= function(severity){
141 	var color	= ConsoleLogger._formatterColor;
142 	if( severity === 'log' )	return color.red;
143 	if( severity === 'warn' )	return color.purple;
144 	return color.green;
145 }
146 
147 /**
148  * Current message formatter
149  */
150 ConsoleLogger.formatter	= ConsoleLogger.formatterIdentity;
151 
152 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
153 //		handle filters							//
154 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
155 
156 /**
157  * Store all the filters
158  * @type {Array}
159  */
160 ConsoleLogger._filters	= [];
161 
162 /**
163  * push a new filter - stackFrame 
164  * 
165  * @param  {Function(stackFrame)} validFor function which determine which stackFrame is valid 
166  * @param  {[type]} severity [description]
167  * @return {[type]}          [description]
168  */
169 ConsoleLogger.pushFilter	= function(validFor, severity){
170 	// handle polymorphism
171 	if( typeof(validFor) === 'string' ){
172 		var path	= validFor;
173 		return ConsoleLogger.pushFilter(function(stackFrame, severity){
174 			return stackFrame.url.lastIndexOf(path) === stackFrame.url.length - path.length ? true : false;
175 		}, severity);
176 	}else if( validFor instanceof RegExp ){
177 		var regexp	= validFor;
178 		return ConsoleLogger.pushFilter(function(stackFrame, severity){
179 			return stackFrame.url.match(regexp)	? true : false
180 		}, severity);		
181 	}
182 	// sanity check - sanity level MUST be defined
183 	console.assert(Object.keys(ConsoleLogger.Severity).indexOf(severity) !== -1, 'unknown severity level');
184 	console.assert(validFor instanceof Function);
185 	// push new level
186 	ConsoleLogger._filters.push({
187 		validFor	: validFor,
188 		severity	: ConsoleLogger.Severity[severity]
189 	});
190 };
191 
192 /**
193  * test if a given instance of severity and stackframe is valid for ConsoleLogger
194  * @param  {string} severity   Severity to test
195  * @param  {Object} stackFrame stackframe to test (in stacktrace.js format)
196  * @return {Boolean}           true if the filter is valid, false otherwise
197  */
198 ConsoleLogger.filter	= function(severity, stackFrame){
199 	stackFrame	= stackFrame	|| Stacktrace.parse()[2];
200 	// sanity check - sanity level MUST be defined
201 	console.assert(Object.keys(ConsoleLogger.Severity).indexOf(severity) !== -1, 'unknown severity level');
202 	// go thru all the filters
203 	var filters	= ConsoleLogger._filters;
204 	for(var i = 0; i < filters.length; i++){
205 		var filter	= filters[i];
206 		if( filter.validFor(stackFrame) === false )	continue;
207 		return ConsoleLogger.Severity[severity] >= filter.severity ? true : false;
208 	}
209 	// if this point is reach, check with Severity.dfl
210 	return ConsoleLogger.Severity[severity] >= ConsoleLogger.Severity.dfl ? true : false;
211 }
212 
213 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
214 //		handle log functions						//
215 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
216 
217 ConsoleLogger._print	= function(severity, args){
218 	var stackFrame	= Stacktrace.parse()[2];
219 
220 	if( ConsoleLogger.filter(severity, stackFrame) === false )	return;
221 
222 	var args	= ConsoleLogger.formatter(args, stackFrame, severity);
223 	var _console	= ConsoleLogger._origConsole;
224 	if( severity === 'log' ){
225 		_console.log.apply(_console.console, args);	
226 	}else if( severity === 'warn' ){
227 		_console.warn.apply(_console.console, args);			
228 	}else if( severity === 'error' ){
229 		_console.error.apply(_console.console, args);			
230 	}else console.assert(false, 'invalid severity: '+severity)
231 };
232 
233 /**
234  * log with a severity of 'log'
235  */
236 ConsoleLogger.log	= function(/* ... */){
237 	ConsoleLogger._print('log', arguments);
238 }
239 
240 /**
241  * log with a severity of 'warn'
242  */
243 ConsoleLogger.warn	= function(/* ... */){
244 	ConsoleLogger._print('warn', arguments);
245 }
246 
247 /**
248  * log with a severity of 'error'
249  */
250 ConsoleLogger.error	= function(/* ... */){
251 	ConsoleLogger._print('error', arguments);
252 }
253 
254 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
255 //		Helpers								//
256 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
257 
258 /**
259  * Overload console.log/warn/error function
260  * 
261  * @todo provide a noConflict  
262  */
263 ConsoleLogger.overloadConsole	= function(){
264 	console.log	= ConsoleLogger.log;
265 	console.warn	= ConsoleLogger.warn;
266 	console.error	= ConsoleLogger.error;
267 }
268
